raw_json.main_html:
Newsletter news

Posted on December 20, 2023 by John MacKintosh in R bloggers | 0 Comments

[This article was first published on Data By John, and kindly contributed to R-bloggers]. (You can report issue about the content on this page here)
Want to share your content on R-bloggers? click here if you have a blog, or here if you don't.

This one goes out to those of you who subscribed to my newsletter, via this blog.

I used TinyLetter, because it was baked into my blog theme.
Unfortunately, while I’ve had absolutely no issues with it, it’s being shut down early next year.

I’ve moved over to buttondown, for the simple reason that it was my original first choice, before I discovered my blog theme.

I have moved subscribers over to the new host, so there’s nothing you need to do, EXCEPT – check your spam filter. Only about a third of you have opened the second edition of the newsletter, which was sent last week. So, I thought I’d send pretty much the same message, via this medium, in the hope it reaches you.

And, if you subscribed, and regret it, that’s fine, you can opt out / unsubscribe easily.

For anyone else who reads this, and who hasn’t signed up – you can check the archives from the link on here.

Related

To leave a comment for the author, please follow the link and comment on their blog: Data By John.
R-bloggers.com offers daily e-mail updates about R news and tutorials about learning R and many other topics. Click here if you're looking to post or find an R/data-science job.
Want to share your content on R-bloggers? click here if you have a blog, or here if you don't.
